Line 104:  WriteLiteral(@">Simple working demo sites</a> repo on Github.
Line 105:      </li>
Line 106:  
Line 107:  <p>
Line 108:      jsnlog.js may not always be able to send log messages to the server, for example if it is down or misconfigured. 
Line 109:  </p>
Line 110:  
Line 111:  <p>
Line 112:      Out of the box, jsnlog.js does not check whether the log message was received correctly on the server. 
Line 113:      This is primarily because working out what to do in case of a failure to send the log message is not trivial.
Line 114:  </p>
Line 115:  
Line 116:  <p>
Line 117:      However, adding code to your client side application to detect and handle a failure to log to the server
Line 118:      is not hard in itself. Here is how to go about this.
Line 119:  </p>
Line 120:  
Line 121:  <p>
Line 122:  Using the 
Line 123:  ");

Line 145:  
Line 146:  WriteLiteral(@"
Line 147:      method on the 
Line 148:      AjaxAppender
Line 149:      object,
Line 150:      you can set a method that will be called just before a log message is sent to the server.
Line 151:      </p>
Line 152:  <p>
Line 153:      It takes 
Line 154:      the XMLHttpRequest object that is used to send the request, allowing you to for example set 
Line 155:      headers on the log request (as shown in the examples given for setOptions).
Line 156:  </p>
Line 157:  
Line 158:  <pre>// Create new beforeSend handler
Line 159:  var beforeSendExample = function (xhr) {
Line 160:      // do something with xhr ....
Line 161:  };
Line 162:  
Line 163:  // Create appender that uses beforeSendExample
Line 164:  var appender = JL.createAjaxAppender(""example appender"");
Line 165:  appender.setOptions({
Line 166:      ""beforeSend"": beforeSendExample
Line 167:  });
Line 168:  
Line 169:  // Get all loggers to use this appender
Line 170:  JL().setOptions({
Line 171:      ""appenders"": [appender]
Line 172:  });
Line 173:  </pre>
Line 174:  
Line 175:  <p>
Line 176:      However, this also allows you to set an 
Line 177:      onreadystatechange handler
Line 178:      on the XMLHttpRequest object. 
Line 179:      This lets you detect whether a response was received from the server and if that response had
Line 180:      a status of 200 (OK):

Line 197:  WriteLiteral(">// Replace send function with one that saves the message in the xhr, for\r\n    //" +
Line 198:  " use when response indicates failure.\r\n    xhr.originalSend = xhr.send;\r\n    xhr" +
Line 199:  ".send = function (msg) {\r\n        xhr.msg = msg; // Store message in xhr\r\n      " +
Line 200:  "  xhr.originalSend(msg);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // Set response handler that checks if re" +
Line 201:  "sponse received (readyState == 4)\r\n    // and response status is not 200 (OK). I" +
Line 202:  "n that case, do something to deal with\r\n    // failure to log the message.\r\n    " +
Line 203:  "xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {\r\n        if (xhr.readyState != 4) { retur" +
Line 204:  "n; }\r\n        if (xhr.status == 200) { return; }\r\n\r\n        console.log(\'Cannot " +
Line 205:  "log to server. Status: \' + xhr.status + \'. Messsage: \' + xhr.msg);\r\n    };</span" +
Line 206:  ">\r\n};\r\n\r\n// Create appender that uses beforeSendExample\r\nvar appender = JL.creat" +
Line 207:  "eAjaxAppender(\"example appender\");\r\nappender.setOptions({\r\n    \"beforeSend\": bef" +
Line 208:  "oreSendExample\r\n});\r\n\r\n// Get all loggers to use this appender\r\nJL().setOptions(" +
Line 209:  "{\r\n    \"appenders\": [appender]\r\n});\r\n</pre>\r\n\r\n<p>\r\n    You will also want to de" +
Line 210:  "al with time outs:\r\n</p>\r\n\r\n<pre>// Create new beforeSend handler\r\nvar beforeSen" +
Line 211:  "dExample = function (xhr) {\r\n    // Replace send function with one that saves th" +
Line 212:  "e message in the xhr, for\r\n    // use when response indicates failure.\r\n    xhr." +
Line 213:  "originalSend = xhr.send;\r\n    xhr.send = function (msg) {\r\n        xhr.msg = msg" +
Line 214:  "; // Store message in xhr\r\n        xhr.originalSend(msg);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // Set r" +
Line 215:  "esponse handler that checks if response received (readyState == 4)\r\n    // and r" +
Line 216:  "esponse status is not 200 (OK). In that case, do something to deal with\r\n    // " +
Line 217:  "failure to log the message.\r\n    xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {\r\n       " +

Line 219:  "}\r\n\r\n        console.log(\'Cannot log to server. Status: \' + xhr.status + \'. Mess" +
Line 220:  "sage: \' + xhr.msg);\r\n    };\r\n\r\n    <span");

Line 232:  WriteLiteral(@">// Handle timeouts
